Alimta is used for what?
Two types of cancer are treated with Alimta: pleural mesothelioma (a cancer of the lining of the lungs that is usually caused by exposure to asbestos).

Alimta is used together with cisplatin ( another anticancer medicine ) when the cancer they are facing is unresectable ( cannot be removed by surgery alone ) and malignant ( has spread , or is likely to spread easily , to other parts of the body ) , in patients who have not received chemotherapy ( medicines for cancer ) before their advanced or metastatic non-small cell lung cancer that is not affecting the squamous cells .
Alimta is used in combination with cisplatin in patients who have not treated it before, and on its own in patients who have received another type of chemotherapy that they have used in the past.
A prescription is the only way to obtain the medicine.
How are they used in Alimta?
A doctor who is qualified in the use of anticancer chemotherapy should only supervise the administration of Alimta.
The 500 mg dose of Alimta is recommended per square metre of body surface area ( calculated using the patient's height and weight ).
It is given once every three weeks as intravenous infusions lasting 10 minutes each.
To reduce side effects, patients should take corticosteroids and folic acid (a type of vitamin), and they should receive vitamin B12 injections during treatment with Alimta.
When cisplatin is given with Alimta, an anti-emetic medicine (to prevent vomiting) and fluids (to prevent dehydration) should also be given before or after the Alimta dose.
In patients whose blood counts are normal and who do not have certain other side effects, treatment should not be delayed or discontinued, nor the dose reduced.
Patients with moderate or severe kidney problems are not recommended to use Alimta.
For more information, the Summary of Product Characteristics can be seen (which is also part of the EPAR).
How does it work, Alimta?
Alimta contains the active substance pemetrexed, which is a cytotoxic medicine - a medicine that kills cells, such as cancer cells, that are dividing - and it belongs to the group of antimetabolites.

In the body, pemetrexed is converted into an active form that blocks the activities of the enzymes they are involved in producing nucleotides (the building blocks of DNA and RNA, the genetic material of cells).
How have studies been conducted on Alimta?
For the treatment of malignant pleural mesothelioma, one main study has investigated Alimta in 456 patients who had not undergone chemotherapy for their disease prior to this.
The effects of cisplatin alone were compared with those of Alimta in combination with cisplatin.

For the treatment of non-small cell lung cancer, the effects of docetaxel were compared with those of Alimta in one study involving 571 patients with locally advanced or metastatic disease who had received chemotherapy in the past.

Gemcitabine was also compared with Alimta ( another anticancer medicine ), both in combination with cisplatin, in a study involving 1,725 patients who had not received chemotherapy for lung cancer in the past.
In all three studies, the main measure of effectiveness was how long they survived the patients.
What benefit has the studies shown with Alimta?
Patients with malignant pleural mesothelioma had their survival time increased by Alimta.
Patients receiving Alimta and cisplatin survived for an average of 12.1 months, compared with 9.3 months for those receiving cisplatin alone.
In patients who had received docetaxel in the past, the average survival time was 7.9 months with it, compared with 8.3 months with Alimta.
In patients who had not received chemotherapy in the past, the average survival time for both groups was 10.3 months.
However, in both studies, patients whose cancer was not affecting squamous cells had longer survival times if we received Alimta than if we received the comparator.
In contrast, patients whose cancer was affecting squamous cells had shorter survival times if we gave them Alimta.

Cerenia is an anti-emetic, this means that it prevents vomiting.

Cerenia blocks an NK1 neurokinin 1 receptor, which acts on the central nervous system.

A large number of studies with Cerenia were carried out either by laboratory dogs or by animal patients at veterinary practises in several European countries and in the USA.

Cerenia is associated with what risk?
